Other Diagrams

Source: vignettes/F_non_model_diagrams.Rmd
F_non_model_diagrams.Rmd

Overview

While the main reason for the existence of flowdiagramr is to create nice-looking diagrams for compartmental simulation models, it is possible to create other, more general flow charts. This vignette gives a brief illustration how this can be done.

Starting Example

As of this writing, the Wikipedia Flowchart page has the following as an example of a simple flow chart.

svg by Booyabazookaoriginal png by Wapcaplet/Wikipedia

We’ll try to recreate a version of this.

Specify the model

varlabels = c("L","P","B","Pl","R","Re")
varnames = c("Lamp","Pluggedin","Bulbout","Plugin","Replace","Repair")

flows = list(Lamp_flows = c("-L"), 
             Plugged_flows = c("L","-no*P","-yes*P"), 
             Bulbout_flows = c("yes*P","-yes*B", "-no*B"),
             Plugin_flows = c("no*P"),
             Newbulb_flows = c("yes*B"),
             Repair_flows = c("no*B")
             )
varlocations = matrix(data = c("L", "",
                               "P", "Pl",
                               "B", "R", 
                               "Re","" ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
mymodel = list(varlabels = varlabels, varnames = varnames, 
               flows = flows, varlocations = varlocations)
input_structure <- prepare_diagram(mymodel)
my_diagram <- make_diagram(input_structure)
plot(my_diagram)
#> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_text).
